claims.object: Measuring the overall spatial autocorrelation of a dataset.

surface_layer.definition: A statistic used to measure the overall spatial autocorrelation of a dataset.
common_uses: Assessing the degree of spatial clustering

deep_layer.mechanism: Global Moran's I calculates a weighted correlation coefficient that assesses the degree to which values are similar to their neighbors.
deep_layer.origin: Developed in the field of spatial statistics.

examples: Analyzing the spatial distribution of poverty rates
Examining the spatial pattern of air pollution
Studying the spatial clustering of disease cases
